rule.title: Game Rules
rule.content:
ã€Objectiveã€‘
Move your pieces on a 7Ã—7 board and build walls to carve out your own â€œterritoryâ€ (a closed area that contains only your pieces). When the game ends, count the squares in each playerâ€™s territory; the one with more squares wins.

ã€Equipment & Playersã€‘
ãƒ»Board: 7Ã—7 squares
ãƒ»Players: 2 (Red and Blue), 4 pieces each
ãƒ»Walls: unlimited, colored by player

ã€Game Flowã€‘
1.Placement Phase:
Players alternate placing their 4 pieces in the order Red, Blue, Blue, Red, Red, â€¦ until all pieces are on the board.

2.Action Phase (turn-based):
 (a). Choose any of your pieces that can still act.
 (b). Move 0, 1, or 2 steps; each step must be straight (up, down, left, right) and may not cross or pass through walls or other pieces.
 (c). After moving, you must place one wall segment on an empty side of that pieceâ€™s square (also required if you moved 0 steps).

ã€Walls & Bordersã€‘
ãƒ»The outer border of the board counts as a wall.
ãƒ»In a two-player game, walls cannot be removed once placed.

ã€End Conditionã€‘
All closed areas on the board contain pieces of only one player.

ã€Scoringã€‘
Count the squares in each playerâ€™s territory; each square is worth one point.

ã€Victoryã€‘
The player with the higher score wins; if scores are tied, the game is a draw.

â”€â”€ Enjoy the game!
